title: Burnley F.C.
summary: Burnley Football Club (/ˈbɜːrnli/) is an English association football club based in Burnley, Lancashire, that currently competes in the Premier League, the top tier of English football. Founded on 18 May 1882, it was one of the first to become professional (in 1883), and subsequently put pressure on the Football Association to permit payments to players. The club entered the FA Cup for the first time in 1885–86 and was one of the 12 founder members of the Football League in 1888–89. From the 1950s until the 1970s, under chairman Bob Lord, the club became renowned for its youth policy and scouting system, and was one of the first to set up a purpose-built training ground.
